wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Henry Morris (14 September 1884 – 24 March 1918) was an English professional football centre half who appeared in the Football League for Leeds City and Grimsby Town, as well as in the Southern League for Brighton & Hove Albion. Later in his career, he coached at Scunthorpe & Lindsey United.

response: *Young Tom Morris (1851–1875), son of the above, also a golf champion
*Tom Morris (footballer, died 1942), footballer who played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C. in the 1890s and 1900s
*Tom Morris (businessman) (born 1954), British billionaire businessman, founder of Home Bargains
*Tom Morris (director) (born 1964), British theatre director, producer, and writer
